data.text: The hopes of a man void of understanding are vain and false:
Whoso regardeth dreams
The vision of dreams is the resemblance of one thing to another,
Of an unclean thing what can be cleansed?
Divinations, and soothsayings, and dreams, are vain:
If they be not sent from the most High in thy visitation,
For dreams have deceived many,
The law shall be found perfect without lies:
A man that hath traveled knoweth many things:
He that hath no experience knoweth little:
When I traveled, I saw many things;
I was oftentimes in danger of death:
The spirit of those that fear the Lord shall live;
Whoso feareth the Lord shall not fear
Blessed is the soul of him that feareth the Lord:
For the eyes of the Lord are upon them that love him,
He raiseth up the soul, and lighteneth the eyes:
He that sacrificeth of a thing wrongfully gotten, his offering is ridiculous;
The most High is not pleased with the offerings of the wicked;
Whoso bringeth an offering of the goods of the poor
The bread of the needy is their life:
He that taketh away his neighborâ€™s living slayeth him;
When one buildeth, and another pulleth down,
When one prayeth, and another curseth,
He that washeth himself after the touching of a dead body, if he touch it again,
So is it with a man that fasteth for his sins,
